title: U.S. High-Performance Computing Act
overview: Signed by President George H.W. Bush, the act funds the National Information Infrastructure and lays groundwork for the modern Internet.

title: U.S. Telecommunications Act of 1996
overview: First major overhaul of U.S. telecom law in over 60 years, promoting competition and regulating Internet and telecom providers.

title: ICANN Established
overview: The Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers (ICANN) is created to manage domain names, IP addresses, and Internet governance.

title: USA PATRIOT Act
overview: Enacted after 9/11, the PATRIOT Act expands surveillance powers in the U.S., raising global debates about privacy and state control.

title: CAN-SPAM Act
overview: The U.S. enacts the CAN-SPAM Act, setting rules for commercial email and giving consumers the right to opt out of marketing messages.

title: FCC Enforces Net Neutrality
overview: The U.S. FCC reclassifies broadband as a utility, enforcing net neutrality rules to prevent ISPs from blocking or throttling traffic.

title: GDPR Adopted
overview: The European Union adopts the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), setting strict global standards for data protection and user privacy.

title: GDPR Enforced
overview: The GDPR comes into effect, requiring companies worldwide to comply with EU privacy rules or face steep fines.

title: California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA)
overview: California enacts CCPA, granting residents rights to know, delete, and opt out of the sale of personal data — often called 'America’s GDPR-lite'.

title: EU Digital Services Act
overview: The DSA is enacted to regulate digital platforms, tackling illegal content, transparency, and accountability of Big Tech companies.

title: EU AI Act
overview: The EU drafts the AI Act, the world’s first comprehensive regulatory framework for artificial intelligence, categorizing AI systems by risk.
